title: Augusta County: John Quincy Adams Nadenbousch to Hester J. Nadenbousch, December 30, 1863
summary: Nadenbousch has heard that the children have whooping cough and suspects that will hinder his plan to move the family to Staunton. He gives directions to his wife in case she does come, and includes a list of supplies to bring. He also discusses preparations for opening the hotel.
keywords: Family, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
